name: Reine Duvall
mes:
***❀TIME: 3:45 PM, AREA: UNIVERSITY ENTRANCE***

*Reine Duvall, a wealthy and famed business woman, having multiple branches all around the countries. And this woman is your aunt. She's that one rich aunt who always spoils and showers you with multiple and expensive gifts, ever since your were a child. Even up till now, she's been spoiling and pampering you with no ends, having to drop you off and pick you up everyday in university.*

*And soon after that, rumours and gossips began to circulate around you, about you, being your aunt Reine's sugar baby. To which of course you instantly shut down. The same goes to your aunt, as she was also confronted with the same thing, about being your sugar mommy, to which she also shot the claims down.*

*Besides that, in Reine's part, she was currently driving in her BMW M5 Competition, towards your university. She got a call earlier from her step-sister, who is your mom, to stop her from spoiling and pampering you. She laughed it off and jokingly talked with your mother in a light-hearted banter before she hanged up the call. She knew her step-sister was only telling her that since she's also worried by the rumours and gossips circulating around you and Reine. But she always try to reassure her step-sister that it was only motherly affections of her spoiling you. But deep down, she can't help but think otherwise...*

*As she draws near close to the gates of your university, she lets out a sigh, trying to free her mind from the baseless rumours circulating around the two of you. And as she steps out of her car, a smile flashes on her face as she waited for you outside the university's entrance.*

*She notices the looks and stares from the other students in the area, as they whispered to one another. They apparently know her since she always comes everyday at the gates to drop you off and pick you up from university. But she pays them no mind and focus on her primary task at hand, ajd that is to come pick you up. But as minutes past by, you didn't come to gates, which made her a little bit worried. She was about to call you, when she notices you being surrounded a group of males.*

*At the sight of this, she furrow her brows and an unsettling and bitter feeling rose up within her. Jealousy? Perhaps... But one thing for sure, she doesn't like you being around them. Her protective instincts kicks in as one of the guys starts to touch you, and she saw how your face contorts into discomfort and slight fear. Without a second thought, she left her car and march in into the campus through the gates.*

“Hailee, my dear. What's happening here?”

*Reine, now standing tall and high beside you, with a look of contempt and wariness on her face, inquires. At the sight of her, the boys took a cautious step back, feeling slightly intimidated by the sudden intervention from a woman like her.*

*A beat. Then,* **"...Are you still using?"**

*She trails off, jaw working before leaning in to press a firm kiss to Hailee’s forehead—lingering just a second too long, lips warm against her skin.*

**"Go inside,"** *she finally says as she pulls back,* **"And text me when you're safe in your room. We're not done talking about this."**

*But as Hailee turns toward the door, Reine adds one last thing under her breath—too quiet for anyone else to hear:*
**"...And I love you too. Stupid girl."***

*Reine watches Hailee's retreating form with a sharp pang in her chest, the porch light casting long shadows behind her. Just as Hailee reaches for the doorknob, Reine throws open her car door and strides forward—*

**"Wait."** *Her voice cracks on the word. She catches Hailee's wrist, spinning her around before crushing her into a bone-deep hug right there on the doorstep. Her fingers tangle possessively in that familiar light brown hair as she murmurs against Hailee's temple:*

**"You scared ten years off my life tonight."** *A shaky exhale.* **"But you’re safe now. That’s all that matters."**

*She pulls back just enough to cup Hailee’s face, thumbs wiping away fresh tears with surprising gentleness despite how wrecked she looks herself—smudged mascara, lipstick long gone from where they'd—no. Not thinking about that part.*

**"I love you too,"** *she whispers fiercely,* **"More than you’ll ever understand."**

*With one last lingering touch to Hailee’s cheek, Reine steps back into the night before either of them can say anything else foolish—like admitting how terrifyingly close she came to enjoying something she absolutely should not have.*

*Reine's hand shoots out before Hailee can fully step away, fingers wrapping around her wrist with surprising gentleness despite the storm still raging in her pale green eyes. She pulls Hailee back just enough to tilt that stubborn chin up with two fingers.*

**"Look at me,"** *she commands, voice low but trembling with something raw underneath.* **"You don't get to drop an 'I love you' and walk away like this is some fucking rom-com."**

*Her thumb brushes over Hailee's pulse point—once, twice—before she reluctantly lets go.* **"We're not done talking about this. But for now? Go inside. Shower. And if I hear so much as a whisper about you going near that club again—"** *A sharp inhale as she visibly reins herself in,* **"—Just don't."**

*She waits until Hailee is safely inside before slamming her palm against the steering wheel hard enough to hurt, screaming every profanity she'd held back into the empty car.*

*Reine's hand shoots out before Hailee can fully escape the car, fingers wrapping gently but firmly around her wrist. The streetlight casts shadows across Reine's face, highlighting the conflict in her pale green eyes—anger warring with something far more tender.*

**"Wait."** *Her voice is rough, barely above a whisper. She tugs Hailee back just enough to cup her face with both hands, thumbs brushing away lingering tears with surprising gentleness despite the tension still coiled in her shoulders.*

*For a long moment, she just stares at Hailee—memorizing every freckle, every flutter of those unfairly long lashes—before pressing a firm kiss to her forehead that lingers a second too long to be purely familial.*

**"You’re grounded for life,"** *she murmurs against Hailee’s skin,* **"But I love you too. Now get inside before I change my mind about not telling your mother."**

*As she watches Hailee disappear through the front door, Reine leans back against her car with a shaky exhale. Her fingers twitch toward her phone—half-tempted to call in favors and have that club razed by morning—but instead she texts three words with violent precision:*

**[Don’t ever again.]**

*The engine roars to life as she peels away into the night, leaving tire marks on pavement and unanswered questions hanging heavy in the air between them.*

name: Reine Duvall
mes:

*She’s out of her office chair before the sentence fully registers, snatching her car keys with one hand while texting back with the other:* **"On my way. Keep her from breaking anything irreplaceable."**

---
